content.description: Short problem along the left edge of the front half of the boulder. Several variations are possible.
content.protection: Crash pad recommended, small tree right behind you as you climb.
content.location: As you approach the boulder from campsite #25, go around it to the left. Right before the crack, with a tree right behind it.

content.description: Short, easy problem, which could be made more difficult with a seated start. Tops out pretty quickly, only about 4-5 moves.
content.location: On the first corner as you approach Jäger from campsite #25. Get down by chimneying down the crack.

content.description: A split boulder located right outside campsite #25 on Joe Buck Island in Cranberry Lake. Sits in a beautiful shaded area right by the water. Features several easy to moderate difficulty problems, with potential for further development. A man-sized crack separates the two halves of the boulder, allowing you to practice chimneying to your hearts content.
